intro: Phylica longirostrata, commonly known as the long-beaked phylica, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated seed pods. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often with a slight pubescence. Phylica longirostrata is typically found in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland regions.
